entry.title: Re: Grouping Multiple Dunning Letters into a Single Notice
entry.content:
Hi @Ayman101 

AspectStandard BehaviorLimitationPossible Options
Unit of DunningOne dunning notice is always generated per Business Partner (customer account).Cannot group multiple BPs into a single consolidated letter.‚Äì
Grouping within BPCan group items by company code, dunning area, dunning level, dunning procedure.Works only inside one BP, not across multiple BPs.‚Äì
By Accountant ClerkNot supported as a grouping dimension in dunning notice generation.Cannot produce one letter for all BPs managed by a clerk.‚Äì
Worklist ApproachUse Manage Dunning Proposals / Create Dunning Notices apps ‚Üí filter by clerk to process all their BPs.Still creates one notice per BP.Improves processing efficiency but not consolidation.
Collections Management (scope item BFC)Provides worklists by collection specialist/accountant; allows consolidated communication options.Requires additional scope item; not part of all Cloud editions.Consider enabling if available in customer‚Äôs license.
Custom Output FormExtend dunning form template or adjust output parameter determination to merge notices.Limited in Public Cloud; may require partner development and strict testing.Could simulate ‚Äúone letter per clerk.‚Äù
Manual ConsolidationExport generated notices and merge externally (PDF/Excel).Not automated, manual effort required.Workaround only.

Summary:
-In standard S/4HANA Cloud, dunning notices = 1 BP ‚Üí 1 letter. Grouping by accountant clerk is not supported.
-Options are: Collections Management scope item, custom output form, or manual consolidation.

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.

entry.title: Missing reference documents for the HU In transaction /SCWM/GRPE
entry.content:
Hi,

In transaction /SCWM/GRPE, I observed that when a Handling Unit (HU) is registered for an inbound delivery and subsequent inbound deliveries are attempted to be assigned to the same HU, the newly added deliveries do not persist as reference documents for the HU after saving. Upon debugging, I noted that SAP executes a memory clear function within the FORM HU_DELETE_FROM_MEMORY of program /SCWM/LHUMAINF08 To delete the new references (new deliveries). It is a potential SAP bug or expected system behavior ?

Thank you.

entry.title: Re: S4 HANA
entry.content:
Hi @manichemi1 ,

I am assuming the issue is in S4 Hana On-Prem version

Possible CauseExplanationHow to Fix (On-Premise IMG)
Ledger not assigned to company codeEvery company code must be assigned to at least one ledger (e.g., 0L = leading ledger).SPRO ‚Üí Financial Accounting (New) ‚Üí Financial Accounting Global Settings (New) ‚Üí Ledgers ‚Üí Ledger ‚Üí Assign Accounting Principle to Ledger and Company Code
Missing accounting principle assignmentEach ledger must be linked to an accounting principle (e.g., IFRS, Local GAAP).Same customizing path as above ‚Üí check accounting principle assignment.
Currency types missingUniversal Journal (ACDOCA) requires defined currency types per ledger.SPRO ‚Üí Financial Accounting (New) ‚Üí Financial Accounting Global Settings (New) ‚Üí Ledgers ‚Üí Ledger ‚Üí Define Settings for Ledgers and Currency Types
Posting ledger mismatchYou tried posting to a ledger that is not active for that company code.Verify document posting ledger matches assigned ledgers.
Universal Journal integration incompleteThe ledger must be active in Universal Journal (ACDOCA) integration.SPRO ‚Üí Financial Accounting (New) ‚Üí Financial Accounting Global Settings (New) ‚Üí Ledgers ‚Üí Ledger ‚Üí Define Settings for the Universal Journal
Field status conflictsWrong field status group may block postings.Check G/L master data ‚Üí field status group alignment with ledger setup.

Summary:

-In On-Premise, the error almost always comes from ledger and accounting principle assignment.
-Make sure company code is assigned to 0L (leading ledger).
-Ensure accounting principle and currency types are correctly linked.
-Check Universal Journal settings in customizing.

entry.title: Re: mapping task in Magration object - Product
entry.content:
Hi @maggie2 ,

Below is the difference for both the options.

Aspect0001 ‚Äì Take Value from Source/Staging Table0002 ‚Äì Take Default Value
Source of the field valueComes from your migration file or staging table (legacy system data).Comes from SAP S/4HANA system default (pre-configured in customizing).
ControlYou have full control ‚Äî each record can have a unique value.SAP decides the value ‚Äî all records get the same default unless you change customizing.
When to useWhen legacy data has important variations (e.g., inspection type differs per material, customer, or asset).When legacy data is irrelevant or missing and you want SAP to assign a standard value.
Impact on migrationEnsures historical or specific legacy values are carried forward.Simplifies migration but may overwrite legacy variation, using default for all records.
FlexibilityHigh ‚Äî each row in the source file can be different.Low ‚Äî one default applies to all rows.
Example (Inspection Type)Material A ‚Üí 01, Material B ‚Üí 02 (taken from source file).All materials ‚Üí 01 (SAP default) regardless of legacy values.

Key takeaway:

0001 = ‚ÄúPreserve legacy values.‚Äù Use when data matters.
0002 = ‚ÄúLet SAP decide.‚Äù Use when data can be defaulted.

entry.title: Re: No service found for namespace '', name 'API_OUTBOUND...
entry.content:
Hello @Kaito2 

Thank you for verifying the URL and your follow-up. If the path is correct, the next most common cause of this error in S/4HANA Public Cloud is an issue with the communication setup.

Can you confirm that the Outbound Delivery (A2X) service is assigned to an active Communication Arrangement? Only upon confirmation will the runtime service /API_OUTBOUND_DELIVERY_SRV;v=0002/ be exposed.

Make sure you authenticate with the communication user for Basic Auth or the OAuth client that is part of that arrangement. Using a business user with catalogue roles will not work for API calls.

For a preliminary assessment, attempt to access the Service URL ‚Üí $metadata via your web browser

Note that for GET requests, X-CSRF-Token is not required; it is only needed for POST and PUT requests.

If $metadata still returns ‚ÄúNo service found,‚Äù then the service is not yet active in the Communication Arrangement, and you will need to adjust that first.

Check the useful SAP Documentation below.

SAP Help ‚Äì Communication Arrangements in Extend and Integrate Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

SAP API Business Hub ‚Äì Outbound Delivery (A2X)

SAP Note 1797736 ‚Äì Gateway error log analysis

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Depreciation areas 92 and 93 not available for Sweden...
entry.content:
Hello @maekman 

The reason why Sweden appears different

In the Public Cloud, the Chart of Depreciation is provided per country and cannot be freely modified.

Finland‚Äôs content includes areas 92 (annual) and 93 difference between Book and Tax).

Sweden‚Äôs designated reporting areas are 01 (IFRS), 15 (Local Tax), and 32 (Local Book). By design, there are no equivalents to 92/93 for Sweden.

What you should do

Use the Swedish areas as delivered: 01, 15, 32.

If you need the Book versus Tax difference, calculate it in reporting by comparing 32 versus 15, for example, the CDS view, Analytical List Page, or standard asset reports

If you need annual figures, such as Finland‚Äôs 92, derive them from posted periodic depreciation and sum them by fiscal year. A separate section is not required.

If this is a legal requirement.

Since Public Cloud does not permit the creation of new depreciation areas, raise an SAP incident (FI-AA) if Swedish law or your auditor requires additional statutory areas beyond what SAP provides.

Below are useful SAP References

SAP Help Portal ‚Äì Asset Accounting in S/4HANA Cloud

SAP Help Portal ‚Äì Country/Region-Specific Features

SAP KBA 3344444 ‚Äì S/4HANA Cloud: Fixed Chart of Depreciation content per country (publicly available)

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Sales rebate processing - condition contract pricing
entry.content:
Hello @KatjaWa,

Thanks for the suggestion. I tested this in Manage Condition Contracts ‚Äì Sales Rebates within our S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition tenant.

As shown in the screenshot below, the system only provides the SAP-delivered condition contract types (0S01, 0S02, 0S03, 0S04, 0SG1, 0SG2, 0SG3, 0SG4 )

Although custom condition types can be created in SSCUI Define Condition Types, they do not appear here. This is intentional.

In the Public Cloud, condition contracts are limited to the pre-delivered rebate condition types.

Creating custom condition types or access sequences does not ensure their availability in the Manage Condition Contracts app.

If additional rebate condition logic is required, the correct process is to raise an SAP Influence Request or an incident to verify if it is included in the product roadmap.

SAP Help documentation

SAP Help ‚Äì Sales Rebate Processing (Scope Item 1BQ)

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Cost Element Category
entry.content:
HI @piyush_kr ,

AspectDetails
Where maintainedIn the G/L Account Master Data (transaction FS00 on-premise or Fiori app Manage G/L Account Master Data in Public Cloud).
LevelChart of Accounts level (not at company code level).
WhyThe cost element category defines how postings flow into Controlling (CO) from FI. Since cost elements are integrated into G/L accounts, the assignment is done in the Chart of Accounts segment of the G/L account.
Examples- Category 01 = Primary Costs/Revenue - Category 11 = Secondary Costs (Activity Allocation) - Category 21 = Settlement
Controlling Area dependencyBecause it is at Chart of Accounts level, all company codes using that COA will inherit the same cost element category for the account.

Summary:
In S/4HANA, the Cost Element Category is maintained at the Chart of Accounts level within the G/L account master (not per company code).

If you find my response helpful, kindly accept the answer and award a Kudos. This motivates me to serve you better.
Appreciate your feedback. Used GenAI

entry.title: Re: REFX-IFRS16-Error-Closing balance 120,000.00 USD liab...
entry.content:
HI @cm_cm ,

AreaError / IssueRoot CauseChecks / Mandatory SettingsFix / Action
Message No. RECEPR503Closing balance 120,000.00 USD liability availableLiability balance already exists in clearing/valuation accountRun Display Balances for Valuation report; compare with contract expected valuesAdjust opening balances (FI posting) if not aligned
Message No. RECEPR505Difference 120,000.00 USD between clearing and contract valueContract valuation ‚â† clearing account balanceReconcile liability account with valuation amountReset & rerun valuation after adjusting
Valuation ParametersContract value not matching simulationWrong valuation area/key date/methodIMG ‚Üí RE ‚Üí Valuation ‚Üí Assign Valuation AreasCorrect valuation assignment, rerun valuation
Account DeterminationWrong account mapping for clearing/accrualClearing account differs from valuation accountIMG ‚Üí RE ‚Üí Valuation ‚Üí Account DeterminationEnsure consistent accounts for accrual/deferral
Opening BalancesContract opening not posted or mismatch existsStarting balance differs from expected contract valueFI Opening Balance PostingPost/correct opening balances
Contract ConditionsCondition values inconsistent with valuationWrong rent/interest/charges setupRECN ‚Üí Contract Master ‚Üí ConditionsAlign conditions with valuation rule
Valuation RunOld valuation docs not resetSystem sees mismatch with prior postingsRECN ‚Üí Valuation ‚Üí ResetReset valuation and run new valuation

Summary:
The errors (503 & 505) both point to a mismatch between contract valuation and liability balance. Start with opening balance reconciliation, then check account determination and valuation parameters, and finally reset & rerun valuation.

entry.title: Re: SAP Public Cloud - Purchase Order Adobe Form
entry.content:
Hello @adnanmaqbool 

Thanks for sharing the links, Jagoda. It is a very useful background on how PO forms and OData work in general.

Just to clarify for S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition: redefining or copying the standard FDP OData service isn‚Äôt supported. In Public Cloud, the extensibility model is restricted, so the supported way to add extra fields, such as 'Tax Code', into the PO Adobe form is:

Apply Data Source Extensions to FDP_EF_PURCHASE_ORDER_SRV or its country-specific variant.

If the field isn‚Äôt available there, create a Custom Field in Custom Fields and Logic, populate it with the Tax Code using a BAdI, and then include it in the form service.

Finally, bind the field in Maintain Form Templates and assign the custom template in Output Parameter Determination.

So, the blogs are still great for understanding the mechanics of Adobe Forms, but in Public Cloud, the extensibility must go through the above tools rather than redefining the OData service.

SAP Help-Extensibility for Output Forms and Email Templates of Sales Documents

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP Commerce Cloud Q3 ‚Äò25 Release Highlights
entry.content:
In the third quarter of 2025, SAP Commerce Cloud introduced key enhancements designed to improve conversion, accelerate innovation, and empower data-driven decision making. Discover new AI-powered capabilities, enhancements to SAP Order Management Services, and SQL View Gateway.

We invite you to explore these SAP Commerce Cloud updates from the last three months by joining our Q3 2025 Release Highlights webcast to stay updated on our latest advancements.

We have the Customer Experience Connect event next week, where we showcase how the latest AI-infused SAP CX solutions optimize operations, generate action-ready insights, and deliver delightful experiences at every step of the customer journey.

Also, check out the Q3 release from the entire SAP CX portfolio.

Now, on to the SAP Commerce Cloud highlights from Q3 2025.

Insightful

Smarter recommendations with real-time stock visibility

The AI-based Shopping Agent now has product stock awareness to allow merchants to configure if out of stock products are displayed in the product recommendations that the Shopping Agent returns. This can lower abandoned carts and improves the customer experience when shoppers know an item is in stock.

Merchants can also configure if they want to allow answering questions about bulk quantities being in stock, an important feature for B2B transactions. The real-time stock visibility increases transparency, boosting conversions with relevant recommendations and improving customer trust.

Check stock on bulk quantities with Shopping Agent

Intelligently optimize catalogs for conversion

Leverage AI to quickly update product information, such as attributes or descriptions, based on system triggers or changes. The Catalog Optimization Agent also reviews product images and recommends enhancements. As a safeguard, a human is in the loop to review the recommendations and publish back to the Commerce catalog.

The Catalog Optimization Agent improves discoverability and conversions, while reducing the manual effort in editing product descriptions.

Settings for Catalog Optimization Agent

 

Connected

Empowering Unified Commerce with Central Order Service

The release of Central Order Service for SAP Order Management Foundation introduces a robust foundation for Unified Commerce, seamlessly integrating online and offline transactions. This paves the way for omnichannel scenarios like BORIS (Buy Online, Return in Store) and BISRO (Buy in Store, Return Online), offering greater flexibility in the customer experience.

 

Additionally, the Central Order Service empowers businesses with a comprehensive 360-degree view of customer purchase histories, enhancing personalization and customer engagement.

 

The rollout of API V3 for SAP Order Management Foundation significantly enhances the solution's performance and scalability, ensuring that it meets the dynamic needs of modern commerce.

 

Automatically push real-time product availability updates to external systems

The Availability Push feature in SAP Order Management for Sourcing and Availability enables proactive delivery of real-time product availability updates to external systems, such as web shops and marketplaces.  

 

This ensures that these external systems always have the latest stock information, reducing the risk of order cancellations due to outdated data. Tailored updates can be configured based on specific channels, products, and frequency, allowing for efficient communication by sending only changes in stock levels.

 

Increase data accuracy and ERP compliance

The Type Code feature for SAP Omnichannel Sales Transfer and Audit implements a robust validation process for ERP type codes, ensuring that only valid codes are transmitted to the ERP system. Each customer can configure a list of acceptable type codes, preventing invalid codes from being processed and halting transactions until corrections are made by an auditor.

 

The feature includes a user interface that facilitates the configuration of valid codes, default settings for critical fields, and options for handling optional fields without triggering false validation errors. Invalid type codes will be flagged as critical errors, and clear, actionable error messages will guide users in correcting discrepancies. Additionally, this system accommodates customer-specific mappings and customizable settings, promoting accuracy and reducing transaction-related issues.


Ensure only validated, customer-specific type codes flow into your ERP with flexible configuration and transparent error handling, resulting in fewer transaction failures, streamlined audits, and improved operational efficiency.

Adaptive

Data Unlocked: Fast, Secure, and Flexible SQL Access for SAP Commerce Cloud

With SQL View Gateway, customers gain self-service access to SAP Commerce Cloud data for efficient analytics, reporting, and integrations‚Äîaccelerating insights and driving smarter business outcomes.

Our new real-time database replicas provide you with direct SQL access that let you build dashboards, enable internal workflows, send information to Data Lakes and more, without affecting your Production database.

You will be able to manage who can access data, the scope of data available, and introduce full separation by creating up to 20 different replicas with independently scaled computes, URLs, IP Filters and authorizations.

SQL View Gateway is provided as a self-service option in the Cloud Portal that you can purchase through Consumption Credits.

 

SQL View Gateway

New APIs Drive Greater Self-Service Efficiency

Scaling Configuration API for sandboxes enables automated scaling and consumption credit savings. The API provides more control for tech-savvy DevOps teams while reducing repetitive Cloud Portal work and possibility for errors. It can retrieve the current scaling, schedule actions such as hibernating or waking environments, and enable scripts to enforce off-hours policies.

Cloud Portal API saves time and can scale dozens of endpoints without added effort. The API exposes endpoint configurations, including Maintenance Mode, for programmatic control. Customers now have API-based automation to turn maintenance on/off for every endpoint in an environment.

SSL Certificate Management API allows for faster operations, fewer mistakes, lower outage risk, and scalable governance. By integrating with your CA/SCM and updating endpoints via API, there are no more manual swaps. Automating the management of SSL certificates is safer and less prone to mistakes.

Framework Update release

We are pleased to announce the availability of the Framework Update with the September 2025 update release! Gain access to the latest functionality provided by Java 21 and Spring 6, while running the most secure and high-performance version of SAP Commerce Cloud. This is compatible with the Composable Storefront update that was released at the same time.

Please register for the SAP Commerce Cloud Tech-Focused Update webcast on October 22 for more details on this and other topics.

For more details on the above release features, check out the following resources:

entry.title: Re: SAP S/4 Hana : Multiple API Call In One Transaction
entry.content:
@Dipto_Arafat 

If all the updates and deletes are on the same OData service, you can wrap the calls in a single changeset within a batch request. If they span multiple services, there‚Äôs no automatic rollback‚Äîyou need to handle it in your event handler by making compensating API calls.

entry.title: Re: Why asset doest not have material code in SAP ERP?
entry.content:
Hello @nithin_pranesh 

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, assets serve as accounting objects. An asset, or an associated AUC, internal order, or WBS element, must be pre-existing at the PR/PO stage. This ensures that goods receipt (GR) and invoice receipt (IR) can be posted accurately to the balance sheet, and depreciation can commence as scheduled.

A material cannot substitute for an asset master because it lacks depreciation key, useful life, or capitalisation information.

 If the final asset is not yet determined, you can buy against an Asset Under Construction (AUC) or an internal order/WBS element and later settle against the final asset.

This is deliberate in Public Cloud; the acquisition of Fixed Assets requires asset creation prior to procurement, and there is no supported creation after a GR variation.

Let me know if you need further information

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: 2508 Maintenance Act/Plan app - (WO) descriptions
Re: 2508 Maintenance Act/Plan app - (WO) descriptions
entry.content:
Hello @Egbert_de_Jong 

Thank you for your question.

I recommend Release Highlights 2508 (Check ID + Description in Apps note),  Custom CDS Views & Maintenance Order Costs for more details.

In summary, in public cloud, the new feature to show ID + Description is only enabled in apps where the underlying CDS views have been modelled with description associations. In the Maintenance Order Costs app, the description fields are not yet exposed in the standard CDS, and that explains why toggling Hided Descriptions does not display the order description.

Currently, there are two options you can explore:

  • One is to check if the field is available through Adapt UI in your tenant.
  • Second is, if it does not exist, you should consider building a Custom CDS View which is based on your maintenance order, include the description field, and expose it in a custom report or analytical app.

What this means is that the issue is not your setup, it is a limitation on the current release. There are chances that Maintenance Order Costs description support might come in future releases.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Purchase order Percentage Price Condition on Purchase...
entry.content:
Hi @Phil_P 

Thank you for your question.

I recommend SOAP Purchase Order create API (SAP_COM_0238), APIs for Sourcing and Procurement & Sourcing & Procurement in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2502 for more details.

To summarise, when you create PO price conditions through API SAP_COM_0238, you must pass percentage-based condition in ConditionRateValue, and not in ConditionQuality. The condition type must be configured with Calculation Type = Percentage (A) in your pricing procedure

This creates a 10% condition. Using ConditionQuantity unitcode =% is not supported and results in 0.00 being displayed.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Authentification required to access the ATO service
entry.content:
Hi @Karthik_Gali 

Thank you for your question.

This blog: Develop & Deploy SAPUI5/Fiori like app using SAP Business Application Studio (BAS) and Troubleshooting provides some insights. Consider also Create Communication Arrangement for Service Order for more details.

To summarise, in public cloud, you cannot use your interactive user credentials for deploying apps through BAS. The ATO service require a communication User assigned to Communication Scenario Software Lifecycle Management- ATO Service (SAP_COM_0838). The user must be configured in your BTP destination with BasicAuthentication. Once you use this communication, user instead of your normal login credentials, the incorrect credentials error will disappear, and the deployment will work as expected.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: 2508 Maintenance Act/Plan app - (WO) descriptions
entry.content:
Hello @Egbert_de_Jong 

You are correct; in the application, the Maintenance Order Costs and the work order description (AUFK-KTEXT) are not displayed as columns in the application. The 'Hide Descriptions' toggle only influences value help texts (F4 helps), and not the visibility of order descriptions within the table.

In S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, the analytical data source behind the Maintenance order only provides the order number. Since standard CDS views cannot be modified in Public Cloud, there are two supported options:

Create a custom CDS view that joins the released maintenance cost CDS with AUFK to include the description, and then build a custom analytical report based on it. Alternatively, submit an SAP Customer Influence request to request that SAP display the order description in the delivered application.

With regard

Chuma

entry.title: Re: RAP ABAP Runtime Error ‚Äì CONVT_NO_NUMBER
entry.content:
Hello @akash_dutta 

Thank you for your question.

The runtime error you are receiving happens because the RAP runtime is trying to convert your attach_id into a number, while you have defined it as a CHAR32. When you enter a value e.g., 3, the system interprets it incorrectly and attempts a numeric conversion and therefore causing the dump.

However, there are solution options you can consider:

  • If you intend attach_id to be numeric, then change the type to NUMC or INT4.
  • If your intention for attch_id was to be alphanumeric, keep CHAR32 but adjust your RAP BO annotations so that the UI and service layer treats it as string, and not as numeric.

In most RAP patterns, surrogate keys are numeric. If you use CHAR32 as your primary key, it often causes conversion errors.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: OAuth2.0 Authentication for S4HC APIs
entry.content:
Good day @JessieJohnson 

Thank you for your question.

I recommend OAuth 2.0 Client Authentication, Authentication of Applications, Consuming the Destination Service & Sales Order (A2X, OData V4) for more information.

To summarise, in public cloud, the only OAuth2.0 flow supported natively are Authorization Code + PKCE and SAML2 Bearer Assertion. Client Credential flow is not supported directly. For a non-user interactive authentication, you either need to use Basic Authentication with a communication user, or you set up an OAuth2.0 Client Credentials flow in SAP BTP XSUAA as the token provider. After you have configured it, your 3rd party application can request tokens from BTP and use them to call S4HANA Cloud APIs.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Range Partitioning for BW Table
entry.content:
BW takes care of the partitioning of its tables on its own, manual intervention is usually not required. 

You mainly have to take care that the table placement configuration is maintained properly. 
- note
1908075 - SAP BW on SAP HANA: Table Placement and Landscape Redistribution
2334091 - SAP BW/4HANA: Table Placement and Landscape Redistribution

Table distribution will then implement the configuration.
- note
2143736 - FAQ: SAP HANA Table Distribution for BW

Message content:
Re-evaluation requested for WBS element P19-12110 and ledger 0L / accounting principle JPAP
Message no. FINS_REV_REC037

 

Diagnosis
A re-evaluation request recalculates the recognition values for the selected object. Re-evaluation requests are created for example:
- In case of errors during the closing run
- If real-time processing of a source document would require a long runtime
- If real-time processing of an event without a source document would require a long runtim

entry.title: The description of the cost center are not displayed.
entry.content:
Dear All,

In the cost center standard hierarchy of the global hierarchy, the description of the cost center with an effective start date of 2025.10.01 was not displayed.

I found the cause. It seems that the cost center's effective date is applied based on the system date.
However, I think the local time specified by the user in the settings should be specified, not the system date.
Users work based on the local time specified in the settings. 
If you tell users that their cost center description are not displayed because the system date is not the effective date, rather than the SAP server's system date, they will ask why their local time is not being applied.

It seems like there needs to be a feature that allows users to specify a start date for cost center  In the cost center standard hierarchy of the global hierarchy, similar to the standard hierarchy screen (T-code: OKENN) in Private Cloud.

entry.title: Re: Request to Register DSC for SAP Ariba TDD Environment
entry.content:
Hi Shohei,

To enable your S-user as a Designated Support Contact (DSC) for the Ariba installation, the following authorizations are required:

Authorizations needed for Designated Support Contact (DSC) access:

  • Display Cloud Data - set at the Ariba installation number level
  • Report Technical Problem - set at Customer Number level or Ariba installation number level
  • Close Cases - set at Customer Number level or Ariba installation number level
  • Send Cases to SAP - set at Customer Number level or Ariba installation number level
  • Display Cases - set at Customer Number level or Ariba installation number level

Currently, your S-user does not have the "Display Cloud Data" authorization for Ariba installation. To proceed, please reach out to one of the cloud administrators listed in Users & Contacts - SAP for Me to request this authorization:

For detailed information regarding S-user authorizations for Designated Support Contact (DSC) access, you may refer to the KBA 3121688 - S-user ID authorizations for Designated Support Contact (DSC) access or Basic access - SAP Ariba Connect. Additionally, KBA 2198153 provides instructions on how Ariba Cloud Administrators can update S-user ID authorizations within User Management.  

If you need further clarification or assistance with these steps, please feel free to let me know. I am here to help ensure everything is set up correctly for you.

Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Fast Track Your Transition to SAP Business Data Cloud! üå©Ô∏è
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community! üëã

Whether you‚Äôre a seasoned data architect or just beginning your cloud journey, navigating the move to SAP Business Data Cloud is a hot topic. Inspired by our recent interactive webinar, let‚Äôs recap key insights ‚Äî and invite you to share your own!

 

üåü Why Embrace SAP Business Data Cloud?

  • Empower both people and AI agents with up-to-the-minute analytics and packaged data products.

  • Make ‚Äúdata as a product‚Äù ‚Äî not just a byproduct ‚Äî your standard, giving everyone context, semantics, and self-service.

  • Spark a culture of citizen data stewardship, freeing up IT to innovate!

  

üß≠ Pillars for a Winning Transition

  • Persona-Centricity: Solutions must work for technical teams, business leaders, AND the growing ‚Äúcitizen‚Äù analyst.

  • Lakehouse Architecture: Combine cost-effective storage with lightning-fast analytics ‚Äî all using open formats.

  • Data Productization: Out-of-the-box, ready-to-consume data models to power your analytics and AI.

  • Open Connectivity: Break down silos and connect SAP & non-SAP data seamlessly.

  • Data Harmonization: Share and exchange trusted data across domains, finally reducing friction!

 

üîÅ Interactive Paths to BDC

  • BW Modernization: Still on BW 7.5? Lift-and-shift to BDC extends support and unlocks automated data product generation.

  • HANA Cloud Migration: Bring your trusted HANA models forward, integrate with powerful engines, and publish new data products instantly.

  • Analytics Cloud ‚ÄúRewire‚Äù: Plug your Data Sphere and SAC directly into BDC. No re-engineering, just more value.

  • Zero-Copy Sharing (Databricks fans, this is for you!): Share data and semantics directly into advanced AI/ML scenarios.

 

 

üõ†Ô∏è Community Resources at Your Fingertips

  • SAP Discovery Center: Stay current with FAQs and technical guides.

  • Architecture Center: Grab and customize diagrams, share your patterns, and learn from validated community posts.

  • Accelerator Hub: Browse SAP data products and packages for every industry.

  • Roadmap Explorer: Track features, data center rollouts, and future capabilities.

  • Trust Center: Review compliance, security, and data residency‚Äîkey for every architect!

 

üë• What‚Äôs Your Transition Story?

We want your input! Which transition path is top-of-mind in your organization? Have another innovative approach? Drop your experiences, questions, or favorite resources in the comments below. Let‚Äôs shape this journey together.

 

üèÅ Ready to Take Action?

  • Sign up for the free BDC assessment and get personalized insights. 

  • Ask about discovery workshops and premium engagement for tailored guidance.

  • Bookmark this blog and join our next community session for more best practices and live demos! (Registration Link)

 

A special thank you to our guest, Habeebuddin Mohammed (h.mohammed@sap.com), for providing valuable insights and sharing his experiences with the participants.

entry.title: Step Into the Future: SAP Business AI Operations Certification for Partners
entry.content:
SAP partners are driving the next wave of enterprise innovation, and artificial intelligence is at the center of it all. As organizations look to unlock new efficiencies and smarter business outcomes, the ability to operate and manage SAP Business AI solutions is becoming a true differentiator.

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre thrilled to introduce the SAP Business AI solutions operations certification, a new credential designed for partners who want to prove their expertise in running, integrating, securing, and extending SAP Business AI. This certification has just been launched, giving early adopters the chance to stand out as pioneers in the SAP ecosystem.

Why This Certification Matters

AI isn‚Äôt just a buzzword anymore. It‚Äôs powering real change in how businesses operate, innovate, and serve their customers. But with new technology comes new expectations. Customers want partners who can do more than just deploy AI - they want experts who can keep it running smoothly, securely, and in line with best practices.

That‚Äôs where this certification comes in. It‚Äôs your chance to show the market that your team knows how to deliver reliable, secure, and high-value SAP Business AI operations. Whether you‚Äôre supporting customers, building custom AI solutions, or managing complex integrations, this credential sets you apart.

What‚Äôs Inside the Certification?

This isn‚Äôt just a technical badge - it's a comprehensive validation of your operational know-how. The certification covers everything from setting up and managing SAP Business AI scenarios and SAP Joule, to integrating AI with business processes and ensuring security, ethics, and compliance. You‚Äôll demonstrate your ability to manage service desks, handle incidents, drive continual improvement, and manage change processes. The program also validates your skills in delivering custom AI development and integration on SAP BTP and applying SAP‚Äôs methodologies for project management. You‚Äôll also demonstrate your skills in quality management, knowledge transfer, event management, and more - covering the full spectrum of what it takes to keep SAP Business AI solutions running at their best.

Who Should Consider This?

If you‚Äôre an SAP partner helping customers adopt, operate, or extend SAP Business AI, this certification is for you. It‚Äôs especially valuable for teams providing managed services, custom development, or integration support. If your clients rely on you to keep their AI solutions humming, this is your next step.

Ready to Take the Leap?

Curious about the details? Want to know how to get started? Reach out to us at SAPOperationsPartners@sap.com or visit www.sap.com/opc for all the info.

AI is changing the game. Make sure your team is ready to play - and win. Get certified, get noticed, and help your customers unlock the full power of SAP Business AI.

entry.title: Re: RE-FX Contracts- Reversal

Hi Alex,

How have you reversed the previous postings? You should NOT reverse the postings directly in FI. When you reverse the valuation posting you should always use the "reverse valuation posting for a single Contract" Fiori app, or if you want to do a mass reversal use "Reverse Valuation Posting".

Using these apps will reverse all the valuation postings for interest, asset, clearing and liability.

entry.title: Re: The description of the cost center are not displayed.
entry.content:
Hello @suyoung_choi3 

Thank you for reaching out

Cost center hierarchies change over time, so what appears in Manage Global Hierarchies depends on the Key Date (Valid On). For example, if a description is valid starting from 2025-10-01, it will not be displayed when the key date is set to 2025-09-30. To see it, set the key date to 2025-10-01.Watch this SAP help Interactive video Open this video in a new window and refer to SAP Help Portal-Manage Global Hierarchies

Public Cloud uses UTC at the platform level. Around midnight, your local date can differ from UTC. SAP Support Portal-3514300 - Time zone Explanation - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Let me know if you need further information

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SAP B1 IR/GR 8% threshold, invoice/credit posting
entry.content:
Hi @tomkrk, it looks like there is a customized validation on the AP Invoice. To confirm this, go to Administration ‚Üí System Initialization ‚Üí General Settings ‚Üí Services and uncheck the option Enable Transaction Notification. 

(Note: This will disable all validations across the system, so it‚Äôs recommended to test this only during downtime and re-enable it immediately after the check.)

After that, log out and log back into SAP, then try adding the AP Invoice again. It should post successfully. Once confirmed, you can coordinate with your partner/support team to modify or remove the validation based on your requirements.

entry.title: Re: "Managing Business Role Changes After an Upgrade" app
entry.content:
Hello @naoakisaruyama 

Single change refers to one upgrade delta for a role, such as replacing or deprecating a catalogue or applying a restriction. The app works best when you focus on one type of change at a time for a specific role. SAP Help Portal: Manage Business Role Changes After Upgrade

Multiple changes indicate that the role has more than one type of modification, such as catalogue replacements and restriction updates or significant differences from its template. SAP Help Portal-Best Practices for Managing Business Role Changes After an Upgrade

You can also check. SAP Support Portal-KBA-3093696 - How to manage business role changes after system upgrade

Let me know if you need further information

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP IQ to SAP HANA Cloud, Data Lake Migration Overview
entry.content:
Migrating from SAP IQ to SAP HANA Cloud, Data Lake (HDL) involves moving your existing data and schema from the on-premise SAP IQ database to the cloud-based HDL. SAP offers a streamlined path to facilitate this journey with its SAP IQ to SAP HANA Cloud, Data Lake (HDL) migration utility.
In this blog, we‚Äôll walk you through the migration process, highlight key prerequisites, and break down the components of the migration utility to help you make a smooth transition.

Overview of the Migration Process

Migrating from an on-premise SAP IQ database to SAP HANA Cloud, Data Lake involves multiple coordinated steps. The primary phases include:

‚Ä¢ Pre-migration checks
‚Ä¢ Schema unload and data extraction
‚Ä¢ Schema loading and data loading
‚Ä¢ Post-migration validation

To support this process, SAP provides an open-source Data Lake Migration utility via GitHub: SAP-samples/iq-to-hdl-migration. This toolset automates much of the migration workflow and ensures compatibility with your target data lake environment.

Prerequisites & Key Requirements

Before initiating the migration, you‚Äôll need to ensure your environment meets the following criteria:

Platform Compatibility: Supported platforms: Linux or Microsoft Windows

Python Environment

    • Python 3.10.x or higher is required
    • Mandatory Python modules: parmiko, pyodbc, psutil

SAP IQ Version: Your SAP IQ system must be running version 16.1 or later

Locale/Collation Support

All locales and collations supported by the data lake Relational Engine are supported except:

    • EUC_TAIWAN
    • CESU8BIN

Target Environment

    • SAP HANA Cloud, Data Lake (Relational Engine + Data Lake Files) must be provisioned
    • Migration uses data lake Files containers only, running on Amazon, Azure, Google Cloud.

Data Lake Client Package

    • The SAP HANA data lake client is required to load data into the Relational Engine and is recommended to be installed on a different machine than the SAP IQ server.
    • Ensure the Data Lake Client can access migration scripts in <utility_scripts_dir>/iq-to-hdl-migration

Migration Process Breakdown

The migration utility consists of three main components, each with a specific role in the migration process.

1. Pre-Migration Utility

Script: pre_migration.py

This utility checks your on-premise SAP IQ system for potential migration blockers such as:

    • Incompatible or unsupported features
    • Unsupported server options
    • User configurations
    • Database artifacts

Configuration:

Pre-migration utility depends on a correctly configured premigration_config.json located in the /Common directory of the Data Lake Migration Utility to function effectively.

Here's a breakdown of the required and optional parameters:

Parameter

Description

Host_Name

Hostname of the SAP IQ coordinator or simplex server.

Port_Number

Port number of the SAP IQ server. Use an integer (e.g., 1912) - no quotes.

DBA_User

SAP IQ DBA user name.

DBA_Pwd

(Optional) DBA user password. Leave as " " to be prompted at runtime.

IQ_Server_On_Same_Host

Specifies if the data lake client and SAP IQ Server are on the same host. Values: Yes or No.

IQ_Host_Login_Id

SSH login ID to connect to the SAP IQ Server host. Optional if both components run on the same host.

IQ_Host_Login_Pwd

SSH login password. Leave as " " to be prompted.

ENC

Encryption between client and server. Options: None, Simple, or TLS(<TLS Client Options>).

IQ_Version

Must be set to 16.1 (the supported version).

IQ_Server_Install_Path

Path to the SAP IQ Server installation.

Datalake_Client_Install_Path

Path to the 17.1 SAP Data Lake client installation.

Ensure all values are accurate before proceeding.

Running the Pre-migration Utility:

Assuming:

    • The utility is located in /home/user/iq-to-hdl-migration/Pre_Migration
    • The config file is at /home/user/iq-to-hdl-migration/Common/premigration_config.json
    •  SAP IQ server is installed at /opt/sap/iqserver

Step-by-Step Commands:

    • Source the SAP IQ environment:  source /opt/sap/iqserver/IQ.sh
    • Change to the Pre_Migration directory:  cd /home/user/iq-to-hdl-migration/Pre_Migration
    • Run the utility:  python3 pre_migration.py --config_file ../Common/premigration_config.json
    • Monitor progress in real time:  tail -f pre_migration.log
    • Output Files (after successful execution) , generated in: /home/user/iq-to-hdl-migration/Pre_Migration
      • pre_migration.out ‚Äì Lists unsupported/incompatible artifacts.
      • pre_migration.log ‚Äì Logs all actions, helpful for troubleshooting.

2. Migration Utility

Script: migration.py

Handles the extraction of your schema and data from SAP IQ to a local directory.

Configuration:

Before running the migration.py script, you must prepare the migration_config.json file with the correct values tailored to your environment. Here's a detailed guide to each parameter:

Parameter

Description

Datalake_Client_Install_Path

Path to the SAP Data Lake Files Client (version 17.1) installation directory.

Extract_Path

A shared directory where all extracted data will be temporarily stored during the migration.

Directory_Name

The name of the target directory in the Data Lake Files container. Must be a string.

Files_endpoint

REST API endpoint URL for the Data Lake Files container.

Cert_path

Path to the certificate used for secure access to the Data Lake Files container.

Key_path

Path to the private key corresponding to the above certificate.

Host_Name

Hostname of your SAP IQ coordinator/simplex server.

Port_Number

The port number used by SAP IQ (e.g., 1912). Must be entered as an integer (without quotes).

DBA_User

The DBA user name used for authentication.

DBA_Pwd

(Optional) Password for the DBA user. If left as "", you will be prompted to enter it securely during execution.

Client_Num_Conn

Number of client connections per server used for data extraction.

IQ_Server_On_Same_Host

Indicates if the SAP IQ server and the data lake client are on the same host. Supported values: Yes or No.

IQ_Host_Login_Id

SSH login ID to connect to the SAP IQ host. Optional if IQ_Server_On_Same_Host is Yes.

IQ_Host_Login_Pwd

Password for the SSH login. If left empty (""), you‚Äôll be prompted at runtime.

ENC

Encryption between client and server. Options: None, Simple, or TLS(<TLS Client Options>).

Batch_Size_GB

(Optional) Batch size in GB for extraction. Enter 0 or omit to disable batching.

IQ_Server_Install_Path

The installation path of your SAP IQ server.

IQ_Version

SAP IQ major version. Only 16.1 is supported.

Pre-requisites Before Running migration.py

Before running the migration utility, ensure you‚Äôve completed these critical steps:

    • Run pre_migration.py utility: This checks your SAP IQ environment for unsupported artifacts. Review the pre_migration.out file carefully and address any flagged issues.
    • Configure migration_config.json: Update this configuration file in the Common directory with your environment-specific parameters.
    • Shared Extraction Path: The <extract_path> you specify in your config file must be accessible by all SAP IQ nodes in your environment.

Running the migration Utility:

Migration utility extracts your SAP IQ schema and data, unloading it to a shared location.

Extraction Modes:

You can choose how much to unload by specifying one of these switches:

    • Schema only: --onlyschema y
    • Data only: --onlydata y
    • Full extraction (schema + data): --fullextraction y

Note: Only one of these options can be used per run.

Assuming:

    • SAP IQ server is installed at /opt/sap/iqserver
    • SAP client is installed at /opt/sap/datalake-client
    • You want to extract both schema and data (full extraction)
    • Your shared extraction path is /data/migration_extract
    • Your config file is located at  /home/user/iq-to-hdl-migration/Common/migration_config.json
    • The migration utility will be run on the SAP IQ server host

Step-by-Step Commands:

    • Source the SAP IQ server environment:  source /opt/sap/iqserver/IQ.sh
    • Run the migration utility with full extraction mode enabled: python3 migration.py --config_file /home/user/iq-to-hdl-migration/Common/migration_config.json --fullextraction y
    • (Optional) Specify the Mode Switch, If your SAP IQ server was not started in read-only mode (without -iqro flag), add the write mode option: python3 migration.py --config_file /home/user/iq-to-hdl-migration/Common/migration_config.json  --fullextraction y --mode w
    • Output Files and Folders Generated by migration.py

      Once completed, the utility generates several important files and directories at <extract_path>/Migration_Data:

      File/Folder

      Description

      Extracted_Data (folder)

      Contains subfolders for each table with data files and corresponding SQL load scripts.

      reload.sql

      Schema and artifact definitions extracted using the iqunload utility.

      iq_tables.list

      List of all tables with row counts and sizes in your SAP IQ database.

      AutoUpdated_Reload.sql

      Contains unsupported or differently supported artifacts commented out for review.

      ExtractedTables.out

      Lists all tables extracted along with row counts and table types (BASE, FOREIGN).

      extractFailure.err

      Tables that failed extraction, with failure reasons.

      Additionally, a comprehensive log file containing detailed logs of the entire migration run is created at: <utility_scripts_dir>/iq-to-hdl-migration/Migration/migration.log

3. Data Copy and Load Utilities

These tools handle the data movement from local storage into the SAP HANA Cloud, Data Lake.

Data Copy:

Script: copy_hdlfs.py

The copy_hdlfs.py script is part of the Data Lake Migration Utility and is designed to upload extracted data to the Data Lake Files container.

The utility requires the migration_config.json configuration file, which should be located in the Common directory.

Prerequisites: Before running the copy_hdlfs.py script, ensure you‚Äôve completed the following steps:

    • You have executed the migration.py utility to extract schema and data from your on-premise SAP IQ system.
    • You have successfully created a Data Lake Relational Engine instance in your SAP HANA Cloud environment.

Running copy_hdlfs.py: python3 copy_hdlfs.py --config_file /home/user/iq-to-hdl-migration/Common/migration_config.json

Data Load:

Script: load_schema_and_data.py (Loads schema and data into the Relational Engine)

Prerequisites: Before you run the load_schema_and_data.py script, make sure you've completed the following steps:

    • Update Configuration
      Edit the load_config.json file located in the Common directory with the necessary parameters for your environment.
    • Copy Schema and Data Files
      Use the copy_hdlfs.py script to copy the extracted schema and data from your on-premise SAP IQ to your data lake's Files container.

Configuration:

The load_config.json configuration file holds all the necessary parameters for the load_schema_and_data.py utility.

Below is a breakdown of the parameters you need to configure, along with explanations for each:

Parameter

Description

Datalake_Client_Install_Path

Path to the SAP Data Lake Files client installation directory (version 17.1).

Extract_Path

Shared directory location where the data extracted during migration is stored.

Directory_Name

Name of the directory in the Data Lake Files container where extracted SAP IQ data is copied.

Files_endpoint

REST API endpoint URL for accessing the Data Lake Files container.

Cert_path

Path to the certificate used for secure access to the Data Lake Files container.

Key_path

Path to the private key for certificate authentication.

HDLADMIN_User

Username for the HDLADMIN account.

HDLADMIN_Pwd

(Optional) Password for the HDLADMIN user. If left empty (""), you will be prompted to enter it securely.

HDL_Coord_Endpoint

Endpoint URL of the Data Lake Relational Engine coordinator node.

HDL_Worker_Endpoint

Endpoint URL of the Data Lake Relational Engine worker node.

HDL_Num_Worker_Conn

Total number of client connections to the worker node. Enter as an integer (no quotes).

HDL_Num_Coord_Conn

(Optional) Number of client connections to the coordinator node. Enter an integer or leave empty.

Object_Store_Copy_Validation

Validation flag for copied objects. Set to Yes or No. Important: If batch extraction is enabled (via Batch_Size_GB in migration_config.json), this must be set to No. Any other value will cause the load_schema_and_data.py script to fail.

Running the utility:

Assuming:

    • SAP client is installed at /opt/sap/datalake-client
    • You want to perform a full load (both schema and data).
    • Your config file (load_config.json) is located at  /home/user/iq-to-hdl-migration/Common/load_config.json

Step-by-Step Commands:

    • Source the Data Lake environment: source /opt/sap/datalake-client/IQ.sh
    • Navigate to the Migration Directory and run the desired load command based on your needs:

      Load Type

      Command

      Schema only

      python3 load_schema_and_data.py --config_file /home/user/iq-to-hdl-migration/Common/load_config.json --onlyschema y

      Data only

      python3 load_schema_and_data.py --config_file /home/user/iq-to-hdl-migration/Common/load_config.json --onlydata y

      Schema + Data (Full Load)

      python3 load_schema_and_data.py --config_file/home/user/iq-to-hdl-migration/Common/load_config.json --fullload y

      After Execution:

      Check this directory for logs and results: <extract_path>/Migration_Data

      Key files include:
      • HDL_LoadedTables.out ‚Äì Successfully loaded tables
      • HDL_LoadFailure.err ‚Äì Tables that failed to load
      • HDL_LoadSchema.log ‚Äì Schema load log
      • <utility_scripts_dir>/iq-to-hdl-migration/Migration/load_schema_and_data.log ‚Äì Full utility log
      • /HDL_Conn_Logs/ ‚Äì Per-table DBISQL logs

Post-Migration Validation:

Data Validation

  • After running load_schema_and_data.py:
    • A row-count validation is performed for each table.
    • If row counts do not match, the transaction is rolled back and not committed.
    • This ensures data integrity in the migrated environment.

Login and User Management

  • Default users created: These are SAP internal accounts only (not accessible to customers).
    • saptu
    • sapsupport

Privileges and Roles

  • Some privileges/roles are unsupported in the Data Lake Relational Engine.
  • During migration:
    • These unsupported roles/privileges are revoked automatically.

Post-Migration Cleanup Steps:

  • Remove Migration Data from Files Container
  • Remove Migration Scripts from SAP IQ

Known Limitations

File Size Restriction: The hdlfscli utility currently does not support files larger than 95 GB. SAP is reportedly working on a workaround for Windows-based systems
